contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Transformation (novel)|the 1988 novel by Whitley Strieber|Whitley Strieber#Communion and "The Visitors"}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2013}} {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | name = Carol Berg | image = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Novelist | nationality = American| period = 2000 â€“ present | genre = [[Fantasy]], [[Historical Fiction]] | subject = | movement = | influences = | influenced = | signature = | website =http://textcrumbs.blogspot.com/ }} '''Carol Berg''' is the author of several [[fantasy fiction|fantasy]] novels, including the books from the ''Rai-Kirah'' series, ''Song of the Beast'', the books from ''The Bridge of D'Arnath'' series, and the ''Lighthouse'' novels. In January 2010, she introduced a new series with the release of ''The Spirit Lens: A Novel of the Collegia Magica''. Berg holds a degree in mathematics from [[Rice University]], and a degree in computer science from the [[University of Colorado system|University of Colorado]].<ref>[http://errol.oclc.org/laf/no00-68170.html Library of Congress name authority file]</ref> Before writing full-time, she designed software.
